articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Lao Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Congratulatory Message to Lao Party Leader
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, sent a congratulatory message to Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, on January 22.
					 The message sent warm congratulations to Bounnhang Vorachith on his election as general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party at its 10th Congress.
					
					 The message noted that his election is an expression of the deep trust and expectation of all the party members and people towards him.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties and countries provided by the preceding leaders would grow stronger in the joint struggle for socialism in the future, the message wished the general secretary great success in his responsible work for the development of the party and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Ugandan President
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni on Jan. 22 on the 30th anniversary of the victory of the Uganda National Resistance Movement.
					 Kim said in the message that he was pleased with the success made by the Ugandan government and people in their work to defend the sovereignty of the country and consolidate the national unity and socio-economic progress under the correct leadership of the president.
					
					 The message sincerely wished the president, close friend of the Korean people, good health and greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the Ugandan people, expressing the belief in further development of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Uganda.

articles.title: Greetings to Uganda National Resistance Movement
articles.content:
Greetings to Uganda National Resistance Movement
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Monday sent a message of greeting to the Central Council of the Uganda National Resistance Movement on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of victory of the movement.
					 The message said that the Workers' Party of Korea is pleased with the big success made by the Ugandan government and people for the national reconciliation and unity and the country's development over the past three decades under the leadership of the movement.
					
					 It sincerely wished the movement bigger success in the work for its development and the country's prosperity, expressing the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Taean Heavy Machine Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Taean Heavy Machine Complex
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Taean Heavy Machine Complex.
					 He went round various places of the complex high-spirited with the production of the custom-built equipment.
					
					 At the consultative meeting held on the spot he underscored the need for the complex to finish the production of the generating equipment for the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station No. 3 within the scheduled day and for the relevant units to make an unconditional supply of raw and other materials for production.
					
					 Going round the construction site of the Athletic Apparatus Factory, the premier called for regarding the principle of giving priority to self-development as one's lifeline, and increasing the proportion of home-made equipment and putting them on a modern basis and completing the project at an early date.

articles.title: Women of Cuban Embassy Visit Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
articles.content:
Women of Cuban Embassy Visit Pyongyang Maternity Hospital
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Women of the Cuban embassy here Monday visited the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital on the 57th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution. 
					 They went round treatment rooms, sickrooms and the Breast Tumour Institute of the hospital. 
					
					 At the end of the visit Nidia Esperanza Labarrere, wife of the Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, wrote in the visitor's book that she was very pleased to see the magnificent architecture of the hospital and its development of high level of medical technology. I was moved to see medical workers of the hospital devoting themselves to treating patients, she added. She sincerely wished the hospital better success in the future.
					
					 The visitors presented a souvenir to the hospital.

articles.title: Home-made Electric Goods Win Popularity in DPRK
articles.content:
Home-made Electric Goods Win Popularity in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Chonbong Exchange Company in the DPRK has turned out electric goods popular among citizens with domestic technology.
					 According to its section chief Kim Ku Nam, the company takes it as an important policy-oriented requirement to improve product quality, ensure domestic production of equipment and rely on locally available raw and other materials as supreme leader Kim Jong Un said in his New Year address.
					
					In recent five years it made long strides in localizing high-performance electric products.
					
					 They include gel high-performance rechargeable battery, voltage frequency stabilizer, uninterrupted power supply (UPS) and intelligent high-speed charger. Those products are good in terms of serviceable life and efficiency.
					
					 Technique of producing gel high-performance rechargeable battery and high-power direct-current supply system developed by the company won international and national patents.
					
					 The company is now conducting technical exchange with Russia and Southeast Asian countries.

articles.title: Much Effort Directed to Education in DPRK
articles.content:
Much Effort Directed to Education in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- It is gaining momentum in the DPRK to improve the condition and environment for education and upgrade it as required by the new century.
					 Primary efforts have been paid to improving the condition and environment for education.
					
					 As part of the efforts, it has been pushed forward to rebuild Pyongyang Primary School No. 4, Mirae Primary School and Haeun Senior Secondary School in Phyongchon District and Songyo Junior Secondary School in Songyo District as models.
					
					 A primary attention has also been directed to upgrading education.
					
					 The field of higher education continues putting teaching programs on a practical, comprehensive and modern basis, increasing the number of subjects, extending the application of computer in each technological subject and updating basic core technologies and advanced technologies in major subjects.
					
					 The successful introduction of the universal 12-year compulsory education makes it possible to direct big efforts to the education in fundamental science and technology and improve the experimental and practical education, thus helping schoolchildren deepen their knowledge.
					
					 Factory- and farm-colleges are striving to develop new teaching methods for enhancing the effectiveness of tele-education.
					
					 Meanwhile, preparations for setting up new technical senior secondary schools have steadily carried on.

articles.title: Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Employees of the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory in the DPRK are striving to produce world-level cosmetics with the determination to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with unprecedented labor achievements.
					 In this regard, Rim Jong Hyang, a workshop head of the factory, told KCNA:
					
					 We have directed much effort to increasing the number of world-famous products with a competitive edge as well as boosting production.
					
					 Last year we opened up a prospect for improving the quality of more than 80 kinds of cosmetics and developed tens of varieties.
					
					 We are now producing natural and stable products with locally available raw materials.
					
					 On the other hand, we have made many achievements in establishing integrated production system and putting the production processes on an unmanned, germ-free and dust-free basis.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Properly Face up to Reality and Stop Behaving Recklessly
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Japan to Properly Face up to Reality and Stop Behaving Recklessly
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Of late the Japanese reactionaries are desperately rushing headlong into the moves to turn their country into a military giant backed by their master the U.S. In the meantime, they are working hard to knock into shape the triangular military alliance by plugging south Korea into it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that they are frantically stepping up the preparations to jointly produce new type missiles with the U.S. from 2017. 
					
					 The development of ultra-modern weapons in cooperation with their master under the zealous backing of the government goes to clearly prove that their moves to turn Japan into a major military power have reached an extremely dangerous stage.
					
					 It is the invariable ambition and strategic goal of the Japanese reactionaries to dominate Asia.
					
					 They have long beefed up their armed forces and put spurs to the moves to turn Japan into a military giant, asserting that it was defeated in the war because of its weak military muscle.
					
					 On December 23 last year, Japan's maritime "self-defense force" staged joint military drills including communication exercise in Aden Gulf in the waters off Somalia together with the south Korean puppet navy.
					
					 They are working hard to use the south Korean puppet forces as a shock brigade in launching reinvasion and put the whole of Korea under their control.
					
					 Not content with having huge combat forces, Japan has increased its defence budget to the maximum in a bid to acquire the latest military technologies, purchase new type military hardware and escalate military drills overseas. This is little short of an open declaration before the world of its scenario to emerge a military giant and kick off overseas expansion.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to properly face up to the reality and stop behaving recklessly.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group Keeps Mum about U.S. Introduction of Germs
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group Keeps Mum about U.S. Introduction of Germs
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the south Korean conservative group covered up the U.S. introduction of anthrax and pest germs into the Osan base of the U.S. air force in south Korea, stunning the public. 
					 The Bar Association for Democratic Society of south Korea disclosed this fact on January 21. 
					
					 According to it, the south Korean authorities were aware of the germ warfare test conducted by the U.S. forces after introducing live anthrax and pest germs on June 1 last year, four days after the above-said fact was brought to light at the end of May. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities are trying to evade the responsibility for the incident.

articles.title: Agreement on Sexual Slavery Rejected by S. Korean Religious Organization
articles.content:
Agreement on Sexual Slavery Rejected by S. Korean Religious Organization
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Christian Churches issued a special declaration on Jan. 21 categorically rejecting the "agreement" on the issue of the sexual slavery for the imperial Japanese army.
					 The declaration dismissed the "agreement" made by the south Korean and Japanese authorities on Dec. 28 last year as a politically motivated act of distorting history.
					
					 It held that the "agreement" was an abnormal one as it lacked a written document and was contrary to international practice because it had such wording as "final and irreversible solution" and "refraining from criticizing and accusing each other in the international community".
					
					 It demanded that Japan should be legally punished for the sexual slavery and make reparation and set right the distorted history.
					
					 It noted that the Council of Christian Churches would join the World Council of Churches in positively participating in one hundred million-people signature campaign to be launched by the "national action for the nullification of the south Korea-Japan agreement on the comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army and its just settlement."

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Russian Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Carried by Russian Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The part dealing with Korea's reunification in the New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un was carried by the Russian newspaper Priarmurskiye Wedomostsi on January 20.

articles.title: 70th Founding Anniversary of Youth League Observed in Angola
articles.content:
70th Founding Anniversary of Youth League Observed in Angola
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting and photo exhibition were held by the Youth Organization of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola on January 15 to mark the 70th founding anniversary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
					 Displayed at the venue of the events were photos dealing with the revolutionary careers and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also displayed there were photos showing the might of a youth power. 
					
					 Present there were personages of the Youth Organization including its international secretary and masses and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Luanda.
					
					 The international secretary in a speech said that the ardent loyalty to the party and the leader, total dedication to the country and its people, noble sense of obligation for the revolutionary forerunners and beautiful moral trait are the peculiar qualities of the Korean youth.
					
					 He noted that the DPRK is a country with a bright future and youth power without a parallel in the world.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- An Ethiopian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il) was formed in Addis Ababa on January 15.
					 Nigatu Dagnachew, chairman of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events for praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Accept All Proposals of DPRK: French Organization
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Accept All Proposals of DPRK: French Organization
 Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. should unconditionally accept all proposals of the DPRK for stopping its nuclear test and concluding a peace treaty in return for the U.S. halt to joint military exercises.
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association said this in a statement on January 16.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement on January 15 clearly indicated again the stand of the DPRK on the said proposals.
					
					 The U.S. is insisting on the only precondition favorable to it, claiming that it would not exclude dialogue with the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. is asserting that the DPRK is to blame for taking concrete measures for the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and making all provocations.
					
					 Dialogue is the only way for peace in the peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Bounnhang Vorachith
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion a Bounnhang Vorachith
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- El Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Jong Un envio el dia 22 un mensaje de felicitacion al secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao, Bounnhang Vorachith.
					La misiva senala como sigue:
					
					Envio a usted mis calurosas felicitaciones por haberse elegido en el X Congreso del PPR como secretario general de esta agrupacion politica.
					
					Lo que usted tomo el cargo de un puesto importante deviene la confianza y la esperanza a usted de todos los militantes de vuestro partido y pueblo laosiano.
					
					Aprovecho esta oportunidad para expresar una conviccion de que tambien en el futuro se fortalezcan y se desarrollen mas en la lucha conjunta por el socialismo las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos partidos y nuestros dos paises, preparadas por los lideres antecedentes, y para desearle mayores exitos en sus responsables labores para el fortalecimiento y el desarrollo del partido y para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente ugandes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente ugandes
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 22 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Uganda, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, con motivo del 30o aniversario del triunfo del Movimiento Nacional de la Resistencia de Uganda. 
					El remitente se muestra regocijado de que bajo la correcta guia del mandatario, el gobierno y pueblo ugandeses defienden la soberania del pais y logran exitos en consolidar la unidad nacional y el progreso socioeconomico. 
					
					Manifiesta la conviccion de que en el futuro se fortaleceran mas las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Uganda y desea de todo corazon al destinatario, intimo amigo del pueblo coreano, buena salud y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades por la prosperidad del pueblo ugandes.

articles.title: CC de PTC felicita 30o aniversario de triunfo de Movimiento Nacional de Resistencia de Uganda
articles.content:
CC de PTC felicita 30o aniversario de triunfo de Movimiento Nacional de Resistencia de Uganda
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 25 un mensaje de felicitacion al Consejo Central del Movimiento Nacional de la Resistencia de Uganda con motivo del 30o aniversario del triunfo de esta organizacion.
					La misiva se regocija de que durante los 30 anos pasados el gobierno y el pueblo de Uganda han logrado grandes exitos en las labores para la conciliacion y unidad nacionales y el desarrollo del pais bajo la direccion del MNRU. 
					
					Expresa la conviccion que en el futuro tambien las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre el PTC y el MNRU se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas conforme a los intereses de los pueblos de los dos paises, desea de todo corazon mayores exitos en el trabajo para el fortalecimiento y el desarrollo del MNRU y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Premier recorre Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean
articles.content:
Premier recorre Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean
Pyongyang, 25 de enero (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las labores del Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean.
					Recorrio varios puntos del Complejo donde se levantan las llamaradas de innovacion en la produccion de las instalaciones pedidas.
					
					En la reunion consultiva efectuada en el terreno, Pak destaco la necesidad de terminar a tiempo la produccion de equipos generadores a ser enviados a la Central Hidroelectrica Heroes Jovenes Paektusan no. 3. Y exigio a las unidades concernientes asegurar incondicionalmente las materias primas y los materiales necesarios a la produccion.
					
					En el campo de construccion de la fabrica de equipos deportivos, el premier instruyo realizar la nacionalizacion y modernizacion de las instalaciones al tomar por linea vital el lema de priorizar sus propias fuerzas y culminar la obra en tiempo cercano.
